Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
We're under attack!
Don't worry, Kapitän! I'm here to support you!
@BATTLE
Phew! What a battle!
Great work as usual, Leberecht!
Bitte, Kapitän, we've spoken before about excessive flattery!
Oh, right! Sorry, about that.
I guess I can accept your praise just this once. After all, it's rare we take down such a large Nixe like that!
True...
Hm? You look deep in thought, Kapitän. Is something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: You DID take it out rather effortlessly, didn't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Once was enough! Anymore and I'll start to get angry.

Fields.MenuText: It didn't put up much of a fight, did it?

Fields.DialogueText: Once the Nixen see me coming, they head for the hills! Or "waves," should I say.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing's wrong. That's what's wrong...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not following.
Usually, we face some kind of adversity in these battles, no?
I suppose.
Your bad luck tends to permeate through your everyday life and onto the battlefield.
No need to sugarcoat it...
So, why didn't we have any problems today?
Don't look a gift horse in the mouth! Now, you wanted to see me about something?
Right. We have a new assignment. Come to my quarters at your earliest convenience.
Ja!
You wanted to see me?
Yes, please come in and take a seat.
This is about our next mission, ja?
Exactly. We've been sent to intercept a group of Morganas making their way to a nearby port. Apparently, they total so many in number that only we can dispatch them efficiently.
Wow, lucky us…
Actually, it's very fortuitous that the higher-ups caught wind of this so early. If we had been informed any later, we wouldn't have had time to pincer them.
Oh. I guess that IS pretty lucky, then!
Yes… Very lucky indeed…
Not this again. Can't something just be coincidence?

Fields.MenuText: I've lived how many years now? If this war has shown me anything, it is that coincidences don't happen as often as you may think.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll have to take your word for it. If my day of awakening is the measure for my wisdom, I'm still an infant.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose it might be.

Fields.DialogueText: See? Don't get so worked up, you'll drive yourself mad.

Fields.MenuText: Has anything up until now felt like coincidence?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. It's felt like careful planning from some otherworldly source. You may have a point after all, but it isn't good to dwell on paranoia.
Anyway, that's all I wanted you for.
*ALARM*
Let's handle the Morganas and then you can retire for the evening.
Ja!
@BATTLE
Kapitän, what are you doing out here?
You're driving me crazy, Leberecht!
I am?
I can't eat! I can't sleep! All I can think of is you!
Kapitän... I...! You...!
Don't you feel the same way?!
Sometimes I think that I might, but then at other times I'm not so sure! I mean, is such a thing even possible?! Wouldn't the children come out with little rudders and torpedo mounts?!
What are you talking about?
What are YOU talking about...?
Your bad luck. I'm intrigued as to whether it has truly disappeared or not.
I see...
What did you think--
Never mind! Anyway, did you need me for something?

Fields.MenuText: Are you feeling any different lately?

Fields.DialogueText: Not particularly. I'm the happiest I have ever been working with you.

Fields.MenuText: I thought we could try some sort of test.

Fields.DialogueText: What did you have in mind?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. I really, really need you.

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, please... My heart can't take much more of this.
*ALARM*
Let's handle the Morganas first. Then we can get down to business.
What exactly do you have planned for me...?
@BATTLE
Call it.
Tails!
Right again!
How many is that in a row now?
It has to be at least ten. Maybe more!
I'm scared, Kapitän! The world must be ending soon if God has finally decided to give me a break!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you shouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth?

Fields.DialogueText: You were the one saying these things don't just happen! It has to be some kind of omen!

Fields.MenuText: Should I prep the bunker for doomsday?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja! And keep it quiet from the crew! Modern day bunkers won't house that many people!

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry, I'll protect you.

Fields.DialogueText: As comforting as that sounds, I don't think one person can win against fate itself!
Let's monitor it for now, and maybe we can find out what the cause is.
*ALARM*
We have more pressing matters to attend to!
@BATTLE
What are you up to, Leberecht?
Hm? Just jotting down some notes.
About what, if I may ask?
Well, I thought that maybe if I have by some miracle been cured, I would start making some plans for after the war!

Fields.MenuText: You've yet to make any plans?

Fields.DialogueText: I always had high hopes to be an excellent soldier but never thought I'd be afloat this long!
How morbid...
May I see it?

Fields.MenuText: You may have to wait some time to complete that list.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't mind waiting! It will all be worth it!

Fields.MenuText: Are you not counting your chickens?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, either we win the war and I can do all this stuff, or we lose the war and I'm sent to the bottom of the ocean!
I'm nearly finished, I'll show you when everything's ready.
*ALARM*
Besides, we have bigger fish to fry! Let's go!
@BATTLE
Kapitän! I've finished my list of things to do before I die!
That's a little bit more ominous than I was expecting, but okay. Let me take a look.
Does anything stand out to you?

Fields.MenuText: House a pomeranian?
Become fluent in Spanish?
Start a farm?

Fields.DialogueText: As you know, I've always been worried my bad luck was contagious. I didn't want to subject a poor animal to a life of misfortune.
I've always dreamt of vacationing in a luxurious Spanish villa!
I think after the war ends, a life of peace and quiet on a tranquil farm sounds delightful!
I don't mean to be the bearer of bad news, Leberecht, but I'm not sure if we're going to have time to do all this before your bad luck returns.
You think so...? Oh...
Right. So, we should try and get through as much of this as we can at once!
Really?!
*ALARM*
I'm sure I can add "taking out a few Morganas" to the list!
@BATTLE
Everything all right in here?
Ah, Leberecht, yes, you overheard?
Barely.
I just got off the ringer. It appears it would be "highly dangerous" and "borderline animal abuse" to bring a small puppy aboard ship.
Ugh! What is the world coming to when you can't bring a live animal aboard a destroyer anymore?!
I did check and, at the next port town, one of our retired veterans houses a small breeding scene. He's agreed to let us visit.
Great! You're sure it's okay?

Fields.MenuText: We could certainly use a four-legged friend on deck.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän! And I'll keep an eye on him to make sure he doesn't get *too* friendly.

Fields.MenuText: Just promise to take responsibility for it.

Fields.DialogueText: I will! I swear! I know a dog is for life, not just for wartime!

Fields.MenuText: I do have some misgivings. Don't you have enough on your plate? You already look after the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose, when you put it like that, it's like I have several hundred pets already! Although, none of them are as cute as a pomeranian.
We should be coming up on the port town soon. Let's clear out any Morganas blocking our safe docking.
Ja!
@BATTLE
... No, I'm joking. Trust me, if Command can put up with Belles commandeering dozens of live penguins-
Was?
Don't ask.
That was amazing, Kapitän!
I'm glad you had a fun time. Will that satiate your need for a puppy at least until the war ends?
Perhaps… Are you sure I can't twist your arm anymore?
It was already difficult enough to make this arrangement a reality. There's no need to be greedy.
I see… In that case--AH!
*THUD*
Leberecht! Are you all right?!
Ja... I think I tripped on something...

Fields.MenuText: Has your bad luck returned?

Fields.DialogueText: If it has, how short-lived was that?!

Fields.MenuText: It looks like your spell of good luck is over.

Fields.DialogueText: Already?! Nein, it's too soon!

Fields.MenuText: Are you hurt?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein, but I think my bad luck might have returned.
Let's get you back to the ship. We'll handle any Morganas blocking our exit while you rest up.
Danke.
@BATTLE
I was thinking, Leberecht. Maybe we should hold off on the rest of your list for a while.
Is that so?
At least until we're sure your bad luck has not returned for good.
That makes sense, I suppose. I wouldn't want to drag anyone into my mess...

Fields.MenuText: I've never thought about it like that.

Fields.DialogueText: I know you didn't, but I did. I can't help but worry about the fate of my crew, you know?
Maybe it's just like a common cold or the flu. It comes and goes in waves.
I hope so.
Regardless, we should be entering enemy territory soon. We'll likely have to take out a few recon ships. Let's prepare for battle.
Ja!

Fields.MenuText: Have you always felt this way?

Fields.DialogueText: For as long as I can remember. If I have to act as a bad luck lightning rod to protect the crew, then so be it.

Fields.MenuText: What if I want to be a part of your mess?

Fields.DialogueText: @BATTLE
Good job in that last battle, Leberecht!
Please! We've spoken about this how many times?
Oh, right. Sorry, I just can't help but praise you if I think you did a good job at something.
I know, but still... Oh, it looks like we're receiving a call.
Excuse me for a moment... Hello? Yes... Is that so? No, that's great news... I'll be sure to let her know. Thanks again.
Everything all right?
It seems you've been nominated for a commendation, Leberecht. For your continued work on the front lines. Inasmuch as we have front lines in this chaos.
Really?! I never thought I'd be able to gain such a respectable award!

Fields.MenuText: You want to be respected?

Fields.DialogueText: I think I have all the makings of a great warrior. If only I could keep things together during a spell of bad luck...

Fields.MenuText: I'm proud of--

Fields.DialogueText: *GLARE*

Fields.MenuText: Is this your first award?

Fields.DialogueText: It is! I'll be sure to cherish it.
What a turn of good... fortune...
The good luck has returned! Quickly, there's no time to waste!
*ALARM*
Let's take out the Morganas and then get back to the agenda.
@BATTLE
Man, Spanish is really difficult.
I think learning any new language is difficult. Though at least most European languages share grammatical structures.
Still…
Shall we take a quick break?
Bitte!

Fields.MenuText: So... why Spanish? Why Spain, in a larger sense?

Fields.DialogueText: Spain is home to some of the most beautiful wildlife. I've always wanted a farm, so perhaps I can gain some inspiration!

Fields.MenuText: Are there any other languages you want to learn?

Fields.DialogueText: I think learning most European languages could be beneficial. And, as you said, theoretically, it should be easy, right…?

Fields.MenuText: Do you like any other subjects aside from languages?

Fields.DialogueText: Does eradicating a Morgana as efficiently as possible count? Maybe you could consider that economics?
*ALARM*
Nixen! Quickly, let's take them out!
@BATTLE
We do have Spanish-speaking crew members. Shouldn't you be as fluent in it as they are? Belle powers and all?
Oh, I can speak it. But then if I think about what I said it all starts getting confusing. I guess I need to master the foundations on their own.
... Which isn't to say I'm having a lot of success.
Okay, I think I'm ready.
Then, please, let me see what you've learned.
¿Puedes comprarme más armas?

Fields.MenuText: That isn't the thing I was hoping for.

Fields.DialogueText: It was worth a shot!

Fields.MenuText: What does that mean?

Fields.DialogueText: Never mind!

Fields.MenuText: I suppose I could reward your ingenuity...

Fields.DialogueText: You're the best!
My head is starting to swell. I think that should satisfy today's lesson. Let's continue to meet up regularly and go over the grammar.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's move!
Now, you're speaking a language I can understand!
@BATTLE
We should intercept the enemy sometime soon.
Is that the fleet? In the distance? How many are there?!
You don't think we can fight that many?
I think we'll die trying.
What if we wrap around them?
What do you mean?
Well...
*ONE RIDICULOUSLY COMPLEX EXPLANATION LATER*
And we'll dispatch them all in no time!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not so sure about this...

Fields.DialogueText: Trust me! It will definitely work!

Fields.MenuText: And you're sure this will work?

Fields.DialogueText: Have I ever let you down before? Actually, don't answer that.

Fields.MenuText: If you're sure...

Fields.DialogueText: Full speed ahead!
You heard the Belle, sailors! To arms!
@BATTLE
Phew! We made it!
Barely! The hull is barely patched, the boilers are straining, and we're running out of places to put the wounded. And the area isn't even totally clear.
But--
Next time, leave the decision making to me, all right.
Understood. I'll return to my quarters and--AH!
*THUD*
Are you okay?
My bad luck... Kapitän, I have a theory.

Fields.MenuText: If it's another hairbrained scheme, I'd rather not hear it.

Fields.DialogueText: Just hear me out.

Fields.MenuText: A theory?

Fields.DialogueText: I think it could be revolutionary!

Fields.MenuText: Well, don't keep me in suspense.

Fields.DialogueText: Right.
Let us get away from any potential stragglers before we let down our guard.
Jawohl!
@BATTLE
Kapitän. Please, give me a compliment.

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather not be thrown overboard.

Fields.DialogueText: Just this once, I will allow it.

Fields.MenuText: Is this some kind of trick.

Fields.DialogueText: I promise I won't scold you. Just trust me.

Fields.MenuText: I'm lost.

Fields.DialogueText: Just do it!
You are a very capable Belle and I'm proud to work alongside you.
Now, flip that coin.
Call it.
Heads!
Correct...
I think your influence somehow counterattacks my bad luck! Whenever you praise me, it starts to fade away!
I see. So, your good luck has returned for a short while, then.
We have to move quickly, before it runs out! I don't want to hear another compliment anytime soon!
*ALARM*
Perfect! Just what I need to blow off some steam!
@BATTLE
Here, Leberecht, I picked up this miniature farm for you to get started with.
You shouldn't have!
It isn't much, but I hope it can keep you satisfied until you can get the real thing.
It means more than you could ever know.

Fields.MenuText: I was planning on sending someone into town to pick up some supplies for it. And anything else we could use.
I'm glad you like it.

Fields.DialogueText: I love it!

Fields.MenuText: What will you grow first?

Fields.DialogueText: Considering you got this for me, whatever you like! Just let me know!
*ALARM*
We're not out of the woods yet. This is the last dock in enemy territory. We won't be stopping again for a while.
@BATTLE
There ought to be enough dirt to go around.
Have you decided on what to grow in your garden yet?
I have indeed.
Might I ask what?
It's a surprise. I'll show you when it's grown.

Fields.MenuText: Depending on what it is, I might have to wait several years!

Fields.DialogueText: You better bring a book, then!

Fields.MenuText: Can I have a hint?

Fields.DialogueText: It's something with a lot of meaning behind it.

Fields.MenuText: Do you need a hand?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. I've waited so long to tend to a farm and I don't want to share!
*ALARM*
Bitte, keep an eye on the farm! Let me handle the Nixen!
@BATTLE
There you are, Leberecht. Taking a break from the farm, I see.
Ja. I thought I'd break out my dartboard again. My aim is starting to fall off I've noticed in recent battles.
How's it...
I see. Were you aiming for the floor?

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry, these things take time.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. There's so much I want to do, but no time to do it! Is this how all humans feel with their limited lifespans?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you need a bigger target?

Fields.DialogueText: Care to volunteer...?

Fields.MenuText: I didn't think your aim was THAT bad.

Fields.DialogueText: But it can always be better.
Well, good luck.
*sigh*
Something the matter?
*ALARM*
Let's tale care of the Morganas and then I'll lend an ear.
@BATTLE
So, Leberecht, what's eating you?
I was just thinking how nice it would be to live a life free of bad luck.
I see.
These past weeks have been so nice. Not having to worry about anything.

Fields.MenuText: I can compliment you, if you like?

Fields.DialogueText: To what end? That is a bandage and not a cure, in my opinion.

Fields.MenuText: I can't imagine.

Fields.DialogueText: To suffer with a disease that has no cure is truly a different kind of living hell.
How morbid...
Living a life with no burdens sounds so freeing.

Fields.MenuText: It sure is nice.

Fields.DialogueText: Not the kind of empathy I was looking for...
I have an idea, Leberecht.
*ALARM*
Handle the Morganas, would you? I have something I need to give you.
@BATTLE
You went to fetch something?
Ah, yes. Here.
What is it? A letter?

Fields.MenuText: It wouldn't be much of a surprise if I told you now, would it?
Just open it.
If you don't want it...

Fields.DialogueText: Nein, nein! I want it!
Okay.
It isn't even my birthday.
*ALARM*
Damn! Morganas! Can't we get a moment's peace!
I'll handle them. I want to give this letter my undivided attention.
@BATTLE
Read it aloud.
"Leberecht is a fine and model sailor with all the expertise and know-how required to lead a fleet by herself..."
Go on.
"She has not only won the hearts of her crew, but the respect and admiration of her captain as well."
Good.
Why?
It's a letter of recommendation. Not a compliment, but a formal declaration of your skill to be used for promotion purposes only.
And, if you ever feel in need of a pick me up, I suppose you could read it to yourself in the privay of your own room.
Kapitän... You...

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to say anything, Leberecht.

Fields.DialogueText: I have a feeling you already know what I want to say anyway.

Fields.MenuText: Don't start blushing now.

Fields.DialogueText: I won't!

Fields.MenuText: I meant every word.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm speechless.
*ALARM*
Now, get out there and prove to me that you're worthy of that letter!
Ja!
@BATTLE
Look out ahead, Leberecht!
Those are the Morganas we've been sent to dispatch!
There's so many of them!
Do you think we can handle them?

Fields.MenuText: I should be asking YOU that?

Fields.DialogueText: You told me to let YOU make the decisions from now on!

Fields.MenuText: With you behind us, how can we fail!

Fields.DialogueText: Right!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think we have a choice!

Fields.DialogueText: Then nothing to it but to do it!
Charge!
@BATTLE
We're hardly making any headway!
We'll need a miracle to get out of this one!
A miracle... That's it!
What?
Kapitän! Please, praise me!
What?! Now isn't the time!
We won't stand a chance unless we get some good luck! Just do it!

Fields.MenuText: You're a great fighter!
You're beautiful!
You're a credit to Belles everywhere!

Fields.DialogueText: Wow, I wouldn't go that far, but thanks for lying!
I was hoping for something more to do with combat, but I'll take it!
Damn right! Care for a display!
We'll support you, Leberecht! Let them have it!
@BATTLE
That seems to be the last of them.
Showering you with praise really did work.
Please, don't remind me. Although, I have to admit, it did get me a little fired up towards the end of the fight.
I'm starting to think that perhaps it isn't the praise that brings you good fortune, but the acceptance of your own skill that does it.
What do you mean?
Well, you're always so against flattery even when you deserve it. Maybe this is the big guy's way of saying it's okay to be proud once in a while.
Is that how you feel?

Fields.MenuText: Is that how you feel?

Fields.DialogueText: Are you a parrot?

Fields.MenuText: It is.

Fields.DialogueText: Then maybe I can give it a shot. For you...

Fields.MenuText: It doesn't matter how I feel.

Fields.DialogueText: It does to me.
What do you say then?
I say, I spot a Nixe in the distance and i want to take it out!
@BATTLE
Keep fighting! We've nearly driven the last one back!
@BATTLE
Kapitän, there's something I want to show you.
Is that...?
Look! It's sprouting.
A yellow rose.
I heard it symbolizes friendship. I wanted you to have it for always supporting me.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what to say.

Fields.DialogueText: Not so easy when the praise is on the other foot, is it?!

Fields.MenuText: Thank you so much.

Fields.DialogueText: It still has a ways to go, but it'll get there. Just like someone else I know.

Fields.MenuText: And I'll continue to do so.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you will!
Maybe by the time the war ends, your bad luck will be gone for good.
My luck can't be all bad. After all, every misstep has led me to you.
